system.biography:
TitleFFF 704a Fyvrian Shek-Pvar
Birthday15 Morgat 673
AppearanceAge 46, height 5’0”, medium frame (size 4), weight 171 lb, plain appearance, dark complexion, brown hair, grey-green eyes
Medical/PsycheParasites (–10 on Rhetoric, –20 on Lovecraft), Body Odor (–10 on Rhetoric, –20 on Lovecraft), Xenophobia (Moderate; test WIL×3 to talk to strangers).
Size0
ArmorPlain cloth robes
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box, knife, ink pot and quills, scraps of parchment
Valuables
NotesMabresen’s robe is a Fyvrian focus, granting a +10% CML.

Biography

Mabresen is a recluse and despises the company of his fellow humans. Although he recognizes that individuals may do acts of great good, he considers mankind in general to be deceitful and wicked. His distrust extends to his fellow Shek-Pvar, whom he tolerates only briefly. His fellows do not mind, as Mabresen’s hygiene is abysmal. His fellow Shenava joke that his presence is announced well in advance when milk begins to curdle. Many wonder how he managed to obtain apprenticeship given his sour smell and equally sour personality.

The Fyvria master mage has a great fascination with gargun, gained when he first captured his ward, Fetch. Mabresen theorizes that gargun behavior is an aberration of something once nobler. He believes some enchantment by the Foulspawner has left a lasting mark of corruption that carries through the queens. Mabresen devotes considerable energy to discovering how to overturn the curse and free the gargun so they may be a great and goodly species once more. His fascination is turning to obsession, worrying his colleagues who consider anything to do with Lothrim very dangerous.

With the aid of Fetch, Mabresen secretly gathers gargun eggs so he may nurture gargun into the gentle and peaceful beings he believes they truly are. His efforts are encouraged by the success he has had with his adopted “son.” The wizard has a number of "tame" Araki led by Fetch who now tend the wizard’s herb gardens and hunt game.

The wizard is researching spells that would allow him to change the gargun and create a new species molded to his ideals. Mabresen hopes one day to obtain a princess that can be mated to Fetch and produce a colony. His gargun wards also look forward to that day, but for different reasons....

HOOKS

You Are Hereby Charged. Mabresen’s researches have gone too far and he has been declared renegade. The PCs are hired by a Shek-P’var master to handle the Fyvrian’s gargun while the mages deal with the wizard.

Precious. Mabresen’s research has led him to suspect that the Eye of Lothrim, a powerful artifact, may be found in a gargun hive. He believes that this item will give him a great understanding of the gargun mind and hires the PCs to obtain it for him.

What Is The Law? A band of Araki have escaped Mabresen’s hovel and reverted to their baser natures. They now menace several manors in the area. The wizard reluctantly hires PCs to bring the orcs to heel before there is serious harm causing the local lord to raise a militia and stamp out the newly founded colony.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
